Came up with this idea for a ranged Assassin type, It's been made fore the RP server Arelith which has some of its on rules. I know there is a MASSIVE XP penalty but, doesn't really bother me that much.. I don't think...
Arelith building rules: 1) Server cap is level 30.
2) When taking a class for the first time must have at least 3 levels of it in a row, after that class has 3 levels in it you can dump sigular levels of that class anywhere, also you cant finish with less than 3 levels in a class.
3) Hip's has been disabled.
4) Prestige Class Requirements. The following is a list of Prestige Classes and the RPRating requirements needed to acquire them. In addition to the mechanical requirements, players will also need DM approval and possibly the completion of a DM quest before levels in the class can be taken.
Mechanical requirements listed (e.g. BAB or skills) are valid for basic values, which don't include bonuses from ability modifiers or items. Modifiers to abilities from subraces are valid for feats and other requirements after subrace selection. (On level 1 you will have only modifiers from your base race.)
To apply for a Prestige Class token, please contact DMs in game, via the DM channel.
Notes
Anyone wishing to take multiple prestige classes needs an RPRating of at least 20.
Getting a prestige class token from a DM does not mean you have to use it right away. Letting the DMs know you want a token before you can mechanically take the class gives them time to pull together a quest for your character and discuss their approval of your concept.

My current RPR is 10 so if you need to know if I can get multiple PC. And note that Arelith has very slow levelling, so the character can not be useless while you are levelling.

Also if you want to know any spell changes: http://wiki.arelith.com/Spell_changes#Groups_of_spells There are stacking things for weapons and such as well as individual spell changes incase needed.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
On pre epic feat selection:
WF Longbow, PBS, Rapid shot are all relevant to archery.
I miss Blind fight, Called shot, Extend spell and Improved critical Longbow. I would even consider weapon finesse and toughness before dodge, movbility and the expertise feats if I had room for it.

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
Mick Dagger wrote:On pre epic feat selection:
WF Longbow, PBS, Rapid shot are all relevant to archery.
I miss Blind fight, Called shot, Extend spell and Improved critical Longbow. I would even consider weapon finesse and toughness before dodge, movbility and the expertise feats if I had room for it.
Well, this is being designed as a melee bowyer and therefore not subject to the same constraints as a normal archer i.e. value in Called Shot and less value in Blind Fight for a typical range toon. I see a major problem doing that with a DEX build and no discipline. IKD is going to be a problem.

Now, though it states "ranged" it is really not ranged, strategically, by design. If it were, there would be little benefit to all the dodge-type feats (including ED!) since a range attacker never (well, hardly ever) needs to concern itself with being flanked or caught flat-footed. Not with leg shots and decent trap manipulation. So in this case, Blind Fight is a must (as is PBS) and the expertise feats are wasted while equipping a bow. There isn't enough casting power to warrant expertise for THIS cleric unless trying to buff while in combat, a recipe for failure. Offensive spells will be pitiful and not worth changing over to expertise to cast them.

With all that in mind, I am at a loss to understand the benefit of monk in this build at all. Cleave is worthless with a bow. Evasion will be accrued by rogue. Monk progression only works with kamas and unarmed. So gaining +3 WIS AC & +10% move speed is not worth mucking up a build which would be far superior just as Clc 17/Rog 13 or some similar split... IMHO, naturally.

Add to that the missing Extend and Imp Crit feats mentioned and it could be made more effective than initially conceived. Personally, I would dump elf unless it is some sort of RP value and use halfling to get the +AB & +AC and other assassin-like racial boni and just take shortbow focus. Perhaps there are some "killer" longbows available? Dunno about that but seems elf adds little if anything. The only detriment of significance of shortbow vs. longbow is that the shortie will be easier to disarm while in PBS range.

then again, perhaps there is something basic in the conceptualization that I am missing here. It wouldn't be the first time.

posts.author: KailPendragon
posts.content:
Slow leveling and a 40% XP penalty doesn't bother you much? It seems odd. I don't see cleric here doing much good in the build. I also see no EWF, nor EP which would help a lot AB wise (+3 AB is BIG). I see also no Crippling Strike, while ISA is selected twice.

Anyhow, for a ranged non PrC "assassin" build I'd go with Rogue/FTR halfling slinger and I would keep some melee presence (WF/EWF short sword eg). Rogue 16/FTR 14 or somesuch should work fine. Epic Dodger of course.

A Ranger with BoE and FE selected among the main humanoid races would work well too. Throw in some FTR and rogue to round it off (and depending on race possibly accept a XP penalty), maybe Ranger 21-23/FTR 4-6/Rogue 3.

Or Monk 20/Rogue 10, which gets ED, uber speed (sweet kiting), mind immunity and undispellable concealment when things get hard not to mention a melee backup with monk attack progression, FoB, SF and a nice base damage output (1d20 at monk 16).

Just a couple of ideas...

posts.content:

Also the Travel Domain I thought would be a waste because you can get Haste wands from other players and can brew pots of them as well.
Divine Power is surely a main benefit of the cleric casting repertoire. Harm (neg energy against all non-undead) and Heal (pos energy against all undead) are serious boss killers and well worth having seeing as how neither allow a saving throw. But Haste via items is extremely limited. Duration is limited to 1 turn (10 rounds). If that is satisfactory for your needs, then you can forgo the Travel domain. Selecting that domain, however, allows a cleric to become hasted for a much longer duration. For example, a level 15 cleric's haste spell would last 3 turns with an Extend Spell slot (level 6, btw )... triple the duration from wands/potions/scrolls, a source which is ALWAYS easy to dispel.
for the expertise I thought because I'm going in close up having a +5 or 10 AC might be handy.. but I realize now that it will kill my chances at hitting anything!!
Good. You are catching on! Besides, expertise/imp expertise are not selectable with any range weapon, like a bow, xbow, sling, darts, etc. so you would need to swap out the bow during combat and go unarmed or with melee weapon. Bad idea IMO.
longbow, well that's just because it does more damage.. and elf there is sort of some rp to it.
With cleric buffs especially, the 2 points base damage means very little. You will be getting magical and divine damage from the buffs(both will critx3, btw). What is more important is what kind of enhancements are available on them on your server. For example, a shortbow with permahaste would be an automatic choice vs. a longbow with 2d6 acid damage/massive criticals. Unfortunately, unless you have played a server a lot you wouldn't know what is available. Also, the seeming puny damage of a sling is offset by its bludgeoning damage, a damage type that is least resisted and excellent against undead. If you are set on elf, then that is what it must be as limiting as it may be to the build.
Monk has the reason that i can get gloves boots belts and other equips with +1 DEX and WIS on them
That's what your rogue UMD is for!
and you can get pots that increase WIS as well as Owls Wisdom. giving me more AC.. I don't know if this makes it pointless still but that was my thought on it.
Not a bad idea. Your cleric can cast Owl's itself (even empowered Owl's +3 WIS max with the feat!) so no need for pots. But using an entire class to glean only a bit of AC will weaken your main class(es) too much IMO. A typical cleric build is feat-starved so a class like fighter or CoT would help to grab some of the more important ones. In this case, with only 3 monk levels and a bow, you'll be gaining no useful feat support from the class.
and epic dodge I thought would also help me out with the KD problem, because of missing the first attack the rest might not hit me much? maybe?
Yes. That's true. But for a typical hasted fighter, that is 20% of the attacks. What about those other 80%? As soon as you are hit, you'll be laying prone since without a significant discipline investment you will lose all checks unless the attacker rolls a 1. And the same goes for disarm (same check, I mean). High discipline (or extremely high AC) is the only reliable way to counter KD/IKD on every APR. But a DEX build is not the best to reach adequate Disc level, though with DP, you'll be able to get your check number pretty high if the base skill could be maxed. For example (not suggesting that it is a good idea in this build), if you took the 3 monk levels last you could reach a discipline check of at least 37 while DP was active... probably not bad for a level 30 server.
extended spell Is seeming like a BIG loss!! so shell look more into that.
Extend Spell makes all those round/level spells manageable even at relatively low caster levels. It also neutralizes the benefits of items containing those same short-duration spells which can never be extended. The lower the caster level, the more important is Extend Spell. Finally, all metamagic feats (like Extend Spell, Still Spell, Empower Spell, etc.) provide a certain amount of handy spell book management.
Also.. I have just realized it needs to be pretty strong between 13-20 because that is where most people are up to in level I believe.
That's also good to know from a building perspective. It could affect how long you have to delay dumps and feat selection if that is the case.

Stay tuned. This is a community filled with experienced folks who have played on diverse environments, enough to keep you pointed in the right direction!

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
OK now, so much needs to be said in so little time. I am exhausted so I will be brief.

@ NWN Whiteboy


9 Cleric levels only is HORRIBLE! You need to aim for 15, but with the enormous restrictions from your server, not even that is possible. It's not that the next spell levels will bring you more buffs, its that THE ONES YOU ALREADY HAVE WILL CONTINUE TO GROW UNTIL CLERIC 15. As an example, you have the following buffs:

Divine Favor, Magic Vestment, Shield of Faith, Greater Magic Weapon.

ALL OF THESE BUFFS GAIN INCREASES at Cleric 12. Now since you are a Cleric, your combat prowess comes from your buffs, without them you are worthless. So a buffed 12th level Cleric will have +2 AC and +2 AB compared to your build. If you go Cleric 15, it's +4 AB and +4 AC compared to yours. We're talking buffed, of course.

Read my guide, mate, so you can understand better.

Now if you want Epic Dodge in this class combo, the best spread in Arelith rules is Cleric 12 Rogue 13 Monk 5. That way you can take all 3 Monk levels in a row and still have 2 extra skill dumps later on. I'd go Cleric 12 Rogue 4 Monk 4 pre-epic and forget about spellcraft.

DEX-heavy Cleric / Monks have TONS OF AC, so forget about Discipline. Take Trickery and Travel (+4 buffed AC from Haste), +50% concealment from Improved Invisibility.

Finally, Epic Dodge is best for '1 on 1 situations, while concealment is for when you're surrounded. If you think you can let go of Rogue, then you can make a much stronger more cleric-heavy toon. A cleric 16 Monk 9 SD 5 would be much more powerful because of Cleric buff increases and HiPS, plus you can still take Epic Dodge as long as you take SD or Monk 9 on that last level. The only things you forfeit is Sneak Attack and UMD.

I`m too tired to continue now, sorry. Hopw you find the info useful.

Later!

To further explore the Monk 20/Rogue 10 idea consider a halfling with Str 10 Dex 18 Con 14 Int 12 Wis 14 Cha 8, getting PBS, RS, WF: thrown weapon (shuriken/dart/sling), Called Shot, Blind Fight, Weapon Finesse, IC preepic with a Monk 12/Rogue 8 split and then EWF, AS (or EP), Great Dex, Epic Dodge and Defensive Roll in epic with all ability increases given to Dex. Start as a rogue for UMD immediately and extra skillpoints. Skillpoints spent on Set/Disable Trap, Tumble, UMD, Search, MS, Hide. Ends with a 33 ranged AB, 29 melee if AS is selected in epic +1 if instead EP is taken, AC is 33 or 31 if EP is selected instead of AS, HP 280, all useful skills are in, you get +60% speed (which "stacks" with haste in a peculiar way as can be seen here under "Formula" heading), mind immunity, a 2x/day and 20 rounds long undispellable concealment effect, a useful 30 SR, an always handy +5d6 SA, Epic Dodge, obviously Improved Evasion, a not bad melee option with 20 SFs a day, etc. and no XP penalty.

It can be played as a ninja like "assassin" if desired.

AC Bonus (Ex): When unarmored and unencumbered, the monk adds her Wisdom bonus (if any) to her AC. In addition, a monk gains a +1 bonus to AC at 5th level. This bonus increases by 1 for every five monk levels thereafter (+2 at 10th, +3 at 15th, and +4 at 20th level).

@ NWNwhiteboy

You have 3 choices for doable builds in the rules you mentioned:

1- Cleric 12 Monk 5 Rogue 13: You can end at 16 WISDOM, have 15 pre-epic BAB (which would otherwise be unattainable unless you delay Monk levels to epics, but then you can't focus on Kamas to get the full attack schedule without wasting a good feat in epics with Weapon Focus.

2- Cleric 13 Monk 4 Rogue 13: You get level 7 spells and must find a way to rework your starting stats or stat points to attain 17 WISDOM to be able to cast them. This build would also get more spell slots than the previous, at the cost of 1 AC from Monk 5 and a little worse stats due to your need to get +1 WISDOM, but you'd still be able to maintain 15 BAB.

3- Cleric 14 Monk 3 Rogue 13: You lose 1 pre-epic BAB for more spells and also need to make way for 17 WISDOM. This way you can cast more spells, at the cost of 1 AB and AC and 1 stat point.

Another thing you can consider is dropping both ESF feats for Armor Skin and Epic Prowess. With Divine Trickery and a high DEX modifier, I think your stealth skills are high enough to go undetected for the most part. But I guess that depends on the server.

Other than that it's a good build. 6 CON is bold, but I guess with a high AC and UMD it's of little consequence.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
About Blind Fight, I gotta say that's a matter of opinion. I think Blind Fight is EXCELLENT, and I always try to fit it in any of my melee builds, BUT I wouldn't call it essential, I'd call it a VERY NICE TO HAVE feat. Grim is right, It helps against all types of concealment, but to say it's a must there's a few things that need to be checked:

1- Are you going to PVP?

2- If so, are any spells or abilities that give concealment common among the enemies you will face? (Are there plenty of scrolls of Improved Invisibility, Ghostly Visage, Ethereal Visage for anyone with UMD to use or does one have to have it as a spell or ask a caster to burn them a scroll to have access to it?)

3- If so, have the DMs nerfed any of the spells or abilities that give you concealment? (I played on a server where Improved Invisibility had been nerfed to grant 30% concealment instead of 50%)

4- If not, do many of your enemies have concealment or is it a sporadic thing to find?

5- Do bosses commonly have some form of concealment? Is it dispellable?

6- Do you commonly get blinded or attacked by invisible creatures?

IMO if you can find room to fit the feat without hurting the build, excellent, go for it, but I would think that KD and IKD for a Sneaker are more important, unless there's lots of KD immunities around. Why don't you do this: First try to fit KD and IKD or just KD into the build without removing BF. If you can't then exchange BF for KD

It makes a big difference. When attempting a KD you are considered one size bigger; so if medium you are considered large and can hence KD a huge creature. You also make the opposed checks of the target 4 points more difficult to pass, always because you ar econsidered one size bigger.
